profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T18:27-0400

did.unittitle: Inns and taverns of colonial Philadelphia, 1950-1953
did.abstract: This is research data on taverns and tavern owners in eighteenth-century Philadelphia, used by Graham for his article, "The Taverns of Colonial Philadelphia" in "Historic Philadelphia" (APS, 1953). There is a guide to the data, a bibliographic card file, a card file of owners (1790-1800), and a card file of taverns.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by Robert Earle Graham and accessioned, 12/04/1981 (1981 1468ms).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Relating to this collection is another item by Graham, "Philadelphia inns and taverns: 1774-1780." Unpublished paper, University of Pennsylvania, 1952 (974.8 G76).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Robert Earle Graham is a historian of Philadelphia colonial life; he compiled this collection while a graduate student at the University of Pennsylvania.
